CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. 9, reads: "D.I.'s Match Wigs To Outfits - The intriguing outfits worn by the seven D.I. Club members were enhanced by wigs of matching colors, the very latest fashion from Paris. The brocade and satin hostess 'fancy pants' worn here were 'out of this world.'...The show and cabaret were given to benefit the National Foundation, formerly known as the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis.  Presently, the Foundation has extended its program to include research in heart conditions, birth defects, cancer, and arthritis, with continued support of polio patients. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Margaret West Watson wearing light colored satin pants and sleeveless blouse and bandaged right foot, standing with crutches in front of wooden bench with tufted cushion, in New Arena Supper Club for D.I.'s "March" benefit for the National Foundation
